title: Between 1 October 2017 and 30 September 2018, will an armed group from the Central African Republic engage in a campaign that systematically kills 1,000 or more civilians in the Central African Republic?
preds: Based on general news and GJP consensus.
Based on general news and GJP consensus.

On Friday, over 20 muslims were killed in an attack on a mosque in the Central African Republic's southeast. The attack was committed by Anti-Bakala militants. (http://aa.com.tr/en/africa/attack-on-mosque-kills-20-in-central-african-republic/935640)
Based on general news and GJP consensus.

"The situation in CAR has been deteriorating since late 2016 and well into 2017. Violent clashes between armed groups and targeted violence against civilians, as well as sexual violence towards women and girls, have taken place in Alindao, Bangassou, Batangafo, Bocaranga, Bria and Zemio. As a result, over half a million people have sought refuge in neighbouring states, and 600,000 have been displaced within the country.

"U.N. officials have raised alarms about “early warning signs of genocide.” Diplomats and relief workers say this impoverished country of about 4.6 million runs the risk of an all-out civil war, which would compound the humanitarian crisis and create new security problems in a region already grappling with extremist groups such as Boko Haram."(https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/africa/the-central-african-republic-could-be-on-the-brink-of-a-bloodbath/2017/10/09/b26e59d0-a7bf-11e7-9a98-07140d2eed02_story.html?utm_term=.7df260467bee)
to poor on information and resurces for  more serious barometer
